decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling a combination of creatures that work together to create powerful synergies and win the game. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company, the deck can tutor for specific creatures or put them directly into play. The creatures in the deck have abilities that can interact with each other in a way that disrupts the opponent's game plan while advancing your own. The deck aims to create a toolbox of creatures that can adapt to different situations and outvalue the opponent through strategic play.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to play powerful Eldrazi threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine, as well as planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes cards like Spellskite and Oblivion Stone for disruption and protection, ensuring that the player can outlast their opponent and dominate the late game.

This deck utilizes a variety of creatures with powerful abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By combining creatures like Kitchen Finks, Murderous Redcap, and Melira, Sylvok Outcast, the deck can assemble lethal combos to quickly win the game. Cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company help find the necessary pieces while key lands like Gavony Township provide additional support. The goal is to efficiently search for and assemble the right pieces to control the board and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost and efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent while using burn spells to remove blockers or finish them off. The deck aims to win the game as fast as possible before the opponent can stabilize. The aggressive nature of the deck allows for explosive starts and potential for fast wins, making it a powerful choice for players looking to end games quickly.

The deck focuses on using creatures with powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities to assemble a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing various cards to search for specific creatures and combo pieces, the deck can quickly assemble a winning combination that overwhelms the opponent. The toolbox nature of the deck allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and situations, making it a versatile and potent deck in Modern 1 vs 1 play.

This Aggro - Death's Shadow Modern deck focuses on utilizing the Death's Shadow creature alongside low-cost spells and pump effects to quickly reduce the player's own life total in order to buff Death's Shadow to enormous size. With a combination of efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Street Wraith, along with cards like Temur Battle Rage and Become Immense, the deck aims to deal massive amounts of damage in a short amount of time and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on leveraging early-game aggression and disruption to control the board while also maximizing card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. With a mix of versatile removal spells and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of spells and allow for flexibility in casting various colored spells. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient threats and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Modern Infect combo deck is to quickly infect the opponent by using creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf along with pump spells like Groundswell and Might of Old Krosa. The deck also includes protection spells like Spellskite and Apostle's Blessing to ensure your infect creatures can get through. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with infect damage before they can establish their own game plan. The deck also includes card draw with Gitaxian Probe and evasion with Slip Through Space to maintain consistency and speed.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up to seven or more lands in order to play Scapeshift and sacrifice those lands to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and multiple Mountains, dealing a ton of damage to the opponent in one turn. Cards like Primeval Titan and Khalni Heart Expedition help accelerate the land ramp, while cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow ensure consistent land drops. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this UrzaTron control deck is to assemble the Urza lands (Mine, Power Plant, Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly. This enables the player to cast high impact cards like Karn Liberated, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Wurmcoil Engine to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Platinum Emperion to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own life total. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance through ramping and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and maintaining control of the game. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate, along with disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Mana Leak, the deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check. Snapcaster Mage and Ancestral Vision provide card advantage, while cards like Kalitas, Bloodchief of Ghet and Tasigur, the Golden Fang offer threats that can help close out the game. The deck also includes flexible cards like Kolaghan's Command to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures like Restoration Angel, Geist of Saint Traft, and Snapcaster Mage. By using a mix of white and blue cards, the deck is able to disrupt opponents while applying pressure with powerful threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's spells, ensuring the right colors are available at all times. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure victory through attrition and strategic play.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant alongside removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Terminate, it puts pressure on the opponent from multiple angles. The deck also utilizes hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil provide additional ways to control the board and strip the opponent of resources. Overall, the deck seeks to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creature cards with powerful abilities to create versatile combos and maintain board control. By leveraging cards like Restoration Angel, Kiki-Jiki, and Nahiri, the player can generate value through ETB effects and token creation while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Spellskite and Sin Collector. The deck's toolbox nature allows for adaptability in different situations, with ways to find specific creatures using Chord of Calling. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive elements.

The core idea of this Merfolk deck is to quickly swarm the board with aggressive creatures like Master of Waves and Lord of Atlantis, supported by cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by continually applying pressure with evasive creatures like Silvergill Adept and Harbinger of the Tides, while also having access to utility spells like Tidebinder Mage and Dismember for additional disruption. Overall, the strategy revolves around building a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive approach.

The deck focuses on using small, evasive infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, along with pump spells like Groundswell and Might of Old Krosa, to quickly poison the opponent and win the game. It also includes protection spells like Apostles's Blessing and Spell Pierce to keep the creatures safe and spells like Spellskite and Spell Pierce to disrupt opponent's plans. The inclusion of Wild Defiance provides a buffer against removal spells, making it easier for the infect creatures to deal lethal damage.
